column4: can anyone post their /etc/host* files? I accidentally deleted mine
an empty hosts file could work.
it doesn't :(
*what* does not work?
my internet :(
it can reach the router fine but not the internet. All the other computers on the network work normally
try to access 209.85.148.139 in your browser. what happens?
yes, on that computer
did you mean me with "Damn it does work"?
if so, then it shows you that you can access the internet. probably your dns settings are wrong. how do you connect to the router?
you provide wlan via your phone? what kind of phone? can your phone access websites? try browsing with your phone to a website you have not been to before.
are you talking to me?
then what about my questions?
and you connect to it via the Network-Manager-Applet?
dns settings are set to automatic?
whats in /etc/resolv.conf ?
what do you mean?
how do you try to open it?
as root?
sounds like thats the problem. i/o error... hmm... i never had that.
i would try to delete /etc/resolv.conf and reconnect to the phone.
and see if a healthy resolv.conf gets created.
google says do this: shutdown -r -F now
as seen here: http://superuser.com/questions/111625/i-o-error-on-linux-cannot-remove-directory-as-root
